PageTitle: display mac-address dynamic vsi interface pe-vlan ce-vlan
FuncDef:
The display mac-address command displays address entries.
If no parameter is specified, all MAC address entries on the interface board are displayed.
The display mac-address pbb command displays the relationship between the backbone MAC address and user MAC address.
CLIs: display mac-address dynamic [ ineffective ] vsi <vsi-name> interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } pe-vlan <pe-vid> ce-vlan <ce-id> [ last-change ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the MAC address entries in a specified Virtual Switching Instance (VSI).
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces and question marks are not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays the MAC address entries on a specified interface.
If no interface is specified, the MAC address entries on all interfaces in this VLAN are displayed.
-

Displays the outer tag carried in the packets received by the QinQ stacking sub-interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Displays the inner tag carried in the packets received by the QinQ stacking sub-interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Indicates the time when dynamic black-hole MAC entries were last updated.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display mac-address dynamic vsi v interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/0.2 pe-vlan 88 ce-vlan 100
MAC Address    VLAN/BD/    PEVLAN CEVLAN Port            Type      LSP/LSR-ID
Total matching items on slot 1 displayed = 1
ExtraInfo: The MAC address table is a Port-based Layer 2 forwarding table. It stores the MAC addresses of other devices learned by the device, including: Mac address, port associated with the MAC address, VLAN ID to which the specified port belongs, or bound VSI. When forwarding data, the device queries the MAC address table based on the destination MAC address in the packet to quickly locate the outbound interface, reducing broadcast traffic.
